title: About us
text:
SwissstatsR is the collaboration platform of the R working group within CORSTAT/KORSTAT, the Swiss Conference of regional statistical offices. The group comprises employees of 16 statistical offices of Switzerland. It was initiated by the Statistical Offices of Canton of St.Gallen and Canton of Zürich.
Contact information:
Jan Wunder, Leiter Fachstelle für Statistik

E-Mail
www.statistik.sg.ch

Kanton St.Gallen, Volkswirtschaftsdepartement, Fachstelle für Statistik, Davidstrasse 35, 9001 St.Gallen

title: Swiss Stats R
text: Open source R packages made in Switzerland.

title: Swiss Stats R
text:
Projects








Subscribe to receive our last articles by email:

title: Collaboration workflow
text: This document presents the phases of the SwissStatsR collaboration workflow.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
1. Local Code
Any R script of a member of SwissStatsR can be submitted to SwissStatsR. Our only requirements is that the R code should be related to Swiss Statistics.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
2. GitHub Private

Once your submission is accepted, peer reviewing starts with SwissStatsR members.
You should have an account on GitHub.
Hosting on our SwissStatsR GitHub is recommended but not mandatory.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
3. GitHub Public

SwissStatsR public release of R code is only possible as an open-source R package.
The R package can be hosted on any GitHub repository, including SwissStatsR GitHub, or another DevOps public provider1.
The R package should have an GitHub Action R-CMD-Check badge:

usethis::use_github_action()

The R package should have an open source license such as MIT, GPL or LGPL:

for example: usethis::use_gpl3_license()

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
4. R-Universe

The open source R package should pass R-CMD-Check.
It should also be well documented.
Unit tests are recommended but not mandatory.
Adding a SwissStatsR badge is optional.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
5. SwissStatsR.org

Once the R package hits the SwissStatsR Universe, it will be added on SwissStatsR.org.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
1. Your Code

Any R script can be submitted to SwissStatsR.
Our only requirement is to be related to Swiss Statistics.
Make a submission using the form or by email.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
1. Code Submission

Any R script can be submitted to SwissStatsR.
Our only requirement is to be related to Swiss Statistics.

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
6. Promotion (optional)

You can write an article about your R package on our blog.
Subscribe to our blog here.

Contact information can be found in the About section.

Click here to make a submission

title: Collaboration workflow
text:
Footnotes


The use of GitHub is recommended to ease collaboration and leverage R-CMD-Check GitHub Actions.↩︎
